messageBody:
jxingtang wrote:

> maintaining them in the persistent storage. Then I got better ideas
> from Allan and Mark to refactor my code and use string instead of
> file as input to the testing method. Kevin seems to have the similar
> approach but honestly I do not have the enough knowledge to
> understand it fully.

My suggestion was just to go a step further :

You essentially have three steps :

1. read the file
2. parse the contents
3. process the dom


I noticed in my own code that 1 & 2 are done so frequently that they
deserved their own class called XmlDocument.


Now your code becomes :

void process(File file){
process(new XmlDocument(file));
}

void process(XmlDocument doc){
Element root = doc.getDocumentElement();
// process root
}



The rest of my suggestion was about using xpath to access the contents
of the document. It's a lot less error-prone than walking over the
elements. See http://www.w3schools.com/xpath/xpath_intro.asp.

Kevin
